intro: Gomphandra prasina, commonly known as the slender gomphandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gomphandra prasina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
